title: Definition: True Statements of Standard Normal Distribution
question_text:
Which of the following statements is/are true concerning the standard normal distribution?
I. It is symmetric.
II. It always has a mean of $0$ and standard deviation of $1$.
III. It is normal only if the sample size is large enough (say, more than $30$).
solution:
Statements I and II are correct; the standard normal distribution will always be symmetric and have a mean of $0$ and standard deviation of $1$.

Statement III is incorrect; by definition, the standard normal distribution will always be normal and is not dependent on sample size. Sampling distributions, however, will always be roughly normal if the sample size is more than $30$.

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'C'.
